sense.name: (cause to) fracture or split
sense.commentary: Note: Implies a whole entity being broken, split into parts Includes: CRACK OPEN
sense.examples: The glass cracked when it was heated. She cracked her head open on the table. The tongue on the inner shell has cracked in half on one and is all but cracked on the other.

sense.name: make a sharp popping sound
sense.examples: Don't crack your knuckles! His voice rose in such a high register that it cracked on the question mark. The thunders cracked, the lightening was flashing, and the rain was pouring.

sense.name: be happy; laugh hilariously
sense.examples: They were things that surprised, delighted him, cracked him up. It was the charisma comment that cracked him up. She didn't even crack a smile!

sense.name: have a nervous breakdown
sense.examples: He cracked up after his son died and had to take a couple of months off work. She recently said a cyberstalker had affected her. Others think she just cracked up at some point. She just cracked under the strain of her husband's disappearance.

sense.name: break a barrier
sense.examples: Registrations cracked through the 30,000 mark in the county.

sense.name: solve
sense.examples: As I stated in the original email, I cracked open the code and hacked together some stuff. Criminologists have not yet cracked the case. So our economists finally have cracked the puzzle.

sense.name: CRACK DOWN: suppress
sense.examples: Authorities in cracked down on press freedom in September. They've actually cracked down on remittances coming from this group.

sense.name: open slightly
sense.commentary: Includes: CRACK OPEN NOTE: compare carefully to sense 1; this sense does not imply the breaking of a whole into parts
sense.examples: Abbot again cracked open the door just enough for an officer to force it open. I got out my daughter's tennis racquet, cracked open the window, and clocked the hornet. The piston has moved a distance sufficient to keep the valve cracked open the desired amount.

sense.name: open, unwrap, make available
sense.commentary: Includes: CRACK OPEN NOTE: compare carefully to sense 1; this sense does not imply the breaking of a whole into parts
sense.examples: I first cracked open The Beatles Anthology, a hot-selling new coffee-table book I didn't know we were going to do one until I cracked open the script. I see you cracked open the grape kool-aid but it doesn't seem to have had the desired impact. Congratulations to the Overmundo team, we hope you have cracked open the champagne!

sense.name: idioms--see list
sense.commentary: NOTE: please tag ONLY and ALL of these idioms with this sense GET CRACKING ALL IT'S CRACKED UP TO BE
sense.examples:
GET CRACKING No excuses, get cracking and learn Dutch!
CRACKED UP TO BE Is customer satisfaction all its cracked up to be?

sense.name: reduce to a simpler molecular compound
sense.examples: A feed doped with some level of metal naphthenate is cracked on the catalyst over a number of oxidation reduction cycles.
